channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London Perl and Raku Workshop
item.description: October 26, 2024, in London, UK

item.title: Continuous Integration (CI): GitHub Actions for Perl Projects
item.description: July 14, 2024, in Zoom

item.title: The Perl and Raku conference
item.description: June 24-28, 2024, in Las Vegas, NV, USA

item.title: Getting sarted with Docker for Perl developers
item.description: June 13, 2024, in Zoom

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great CPAN modules released last week;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Score the Defranged Strings
item.description: The main attraction for me was the use of rotor in Postscript, very interesting. Highly recommended.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge #272
item.description: Use of Perl regex makes it easy to get one-liner. Good job, keep it up.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 272
item.description: Nice promotion of CPAN modules. I must admit, the use of CPAN module makes the code compact and readable. Well done.

item.title: Fangs and strings
item.description: No gimmicks and just straight forward solutions in Perl with bonus DIY tool. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Defanged Addresses & String Scores
item.description: Using regex in Perl, Raku, Python and Elixir is worth checking. Amazed to see how each implement the regex. Thanks for sharing the knowledge.

item.title: A Half Liner and a Full One
item.description: Discussion of special flag 'r' alongwith 's///'. Thanks for the gentle reminder.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 272
item.description: Master of one-liner in Perl once again sharing the knowledge with us. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Quick and Simple
item.description: Special one-liner in Raku and many more in Python and PostgreSQL. Thanks for sharing the knowledge with us.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 272: String Score
item.description: Near identical solutions in both Perl and Raku. Great post for all Perl and Raku fans.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 272: Defang IP Address
item.description: Keep it sweet and simple with the use of regex in Perl and Raku. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Defang the Snake Fixated at the Score
item.description: Using CPAN module to get a complete solution. Also PDL is again talk of the town. Highly recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 272
item.description: Smart use of subst() to defang IP in Raku. Line by line discussion is really handy. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: IP Score
item.description: Clever use of subset to create custom type in Raku. Also the smart parameter checking in the method signature is work checking. Keep it up great work.

item.title: TWC272
item.description: Compact and concise pure Perl solutions. Perl regex is unbeatable. Well done and keep it up.

item.title: Defanged and Scored
item.description: Nice to see you back to blogging. Nice demo of recursion to get the job done. Thanks for sharing the knowledge with us.

item.title: First time blogger for weekly challenge, welcome on board. Loved the narrative style of blog. Keep it up great work.
RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 272
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Defang IP Address" and "String Score" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 273
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Percentage of Character" and "B after A". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: The Perl Conference through Lens
item.description: 900+ photos of YAPC shared with us. Please do check out and see if you can find yourself in one of them.

item.title: This week in PSC (150) | 2024-06-06
item.description: PSC sharing updates about state of Perl v5.40 release along with couple of other news.

item.title: Getting started with Docker for Perl developers (Free Virtual Workshop on June 13)
item.description: In this virtual workshop you will learn why and how to use Docker for development and deployment of applications written in Perl. The workshop is free of charge thanks to my supporters via Patreon and GitHub. Beyond this workshop I am running many more, so make sure you check the Code Mavens meetup group and also register in it.

item.title: Perl v5.40
item.description: The latest Perl v5.40 is released and ready to try. Please do share your experience with the team.

item.title: #672 - It's time ...
item.description:
Hi there,

... to celebrate the release of Perl v5.40.

To be honest, I have been watching the MetaCPAN for the updates almost every day for the last one week. The wait was over finally on Sunday late evening UK time. You can certainly take a closer look if you want. I am going to install the latest bundle in the next couple of days and play with it. Having said, I am a bit disappointed to find out that role is not yet implemented in the core OO. I understand the workload on the team, specially Paul Evans. I wish and hope he gets the support and helping hands in getting the outstanding features done quickly. Reason I am curious about role is that I am working on something that uses the new OO syntax and I need to implement role using it. Unfortunately it has to wait until another big release. Still I am very happy with all other new features. I would like to take this opportunity to thank the entire team for all the hard work in getting the release done in a timely fashion. You guys are doing a great job. The entire Perl community is proud of you all. With all the support around, we will get the glory back very soon.

I am wondering when are we going to have the next edition of What's new on CPAN?. I am hoping we would get it by end of this week.

Enjoy rest of the newsletter.
item.dc:subject: editorial
